Subject: Re: [junit] Threshholds for (J)Unit Testing


didoss@... wrote:
> We have upwards of 10 developers working on ~1500 classes.
Our tests are a pain to maintain - takes too long to run completely in
Eclipse before checking in; takes ~6 hours to run and report the
nightlybuild (includes coverage testing); we're nowhere near green bar,
so recognizing when there is something new (from yesterday) is near
impossible, and possibly impractical (in a 40 hour work week).
> I'm not necessarily looking for any answers,...but maybe
someone has some insight - has been there before - or will just
commisserate with me. :)
>

It's hard to imagine that unit tests for 1500 classes would take
that long.

Are you writing unit level tests ? Or system level tests ?

What proportion of your tests hit a database/file
system/network/gui ?

Kevin
